text: hi guys today I'm making a delicious hot
chocolate we found when we were making
this that we really like the intensity
that you get from cocoa powder which is
all this in a lot of hot chocolate with
the richness that you get from some
melted chocolates
I'm using a semi-sweet but if you like a
bittersweet go it's bittersweet you're
going to melt everything together on the
stove in one and a half cups of whole
milk you want the richness of the whole
milk not something skimmed and I'm going
to top this with whipped cream to that
add 2 teaspoons of light brown sugar and
then one teaspoon of cocoa powder all
you need to do is heat it and whisk it
what you don't want to happen is for the
chocolate to sink to the bottom and then
burn there because that will make your
hot cocoa not taste good add a little
bit of salt just a pinch of kosher salt
you don't want it salty you just want to
enhance that chocolate flavor then you
can move on with some cream it's just a
very small amount of cream and the kind
of a big list but it's the appropriate
whisk for whisking creams the balloon
wet what you're looking for here is a
nice softly whipped cream you can see
that I just did that really easily in a
matter of minutes by hand great for your
arms if you didn't get a workout today
serve yourself
[Music]
and sell up some whipped cream on top if
you give this recipe a try let me know
in the comments below tell me how you
like it
